document_title: Testicular atrophy: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Signs of testicular atrophy are often quite easy to recognize, the main sign is shrinkage of one or both testicles. Depending on the age of the man, there may be a number of different symptoms. (3)
Before puberty: signs of testicular atrophy before puberty often include symptoms such as underdeveloped secondary sexual characteristics: little facial hair, pubic hair.; After puberty: when palpated, the testicles are detected to be smaller than normal testicle size (average size is 4-5cm and weighs about 20g). The testicles are not tense when touched. Men experience decreased sexual desire, reduced muscle mass, and less facial and pubic hair.
